title: Dangerous Machinery
body:
Kitchens are full of powerful machines: slicers, mixers, mincers, and blenders. These can cause amputations or severe lacerations if misused.

**Safety Guards:** Never operate a machine without its safety guard in place. If a guard is broken, report it and do not use the machine.

title: Cleaning and Maintenance
body:
Most accidents happen during cleaning.

**Lock Out / Tag Out:** Before cleaning or unblocking a machine, switch it off and unplug it. This prevents it from accidentally starting while your hands are inside.

title: Electrical Safety
body:
Electricity and water don't mix.

- Check cables for damage (cuts or fraying) before use.
- Don't overload sockets.
- Keep electrical appliances away from water sources.
- If a plug gets hot, stop using it immediately.

stem: What must you check before using a meat slicer? (Select two)
options: That the guard is in place
That you have been trained to use it
rationale: You must be trained and the safety guards must be functional. Never use machinery you don't understand.

title: Module Complete
body: You now know how to work safely with kitchen equipment. Respect the machines, use the guards, and always unplug before cleaning.
